definition: to feel about/to grope about/to fumble/to do things slowly
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated

sentences.english: Second, rarely is there anything like a plan to discover and learn.
sentences.chinese: 其二，幾乎沒有考慮到摸索與學習的方法。

sentences.english: He gropes for a lamp, tries to turn it on, knocks it over instead.
sentences.chinese: 男人摸索着想打開臺燈，卻弄翻了它。

sentences.english: On tiptoes I reached up and opened the heavy door.
sentences.chinese: 我踮起腳尖伸手摸索着打開了它厚重的門。

sentences.english: The methods of domestication and cultivation Lactarius deliciosus were groped preliminarily.
sentences.chinese: 初步摸索出馴化栽培松乳菇的方法。

sentences.english: I’ve only joined the firm for only a week, so I’m still finding my feet.
sentences.chinese: 我來到這家公司才一星期的時間，所以一切還在摸索。

sentences.english: The photoinduced permanent polarization of bacteriorhodopsin was experimentally investigated.
sentences.chinese: 實驗摸索了菌紫質激光誘導永久偏振態的產生條件。

sentences.english: He searches his hidden pocket for the cockroach.
sentences.chinese: 他在暗袋裏摸索了一下。

sentences.english: At midday you will grope about like a blind man in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你必在午間摸索，好像瞎子在暗中摸索一樣。

sentences.english: At midday you will grope about like a blind man in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你必在午間摸索，好像瞎子在暗中摸索一樣。

sentences.english: In pursuing them, we should be careful to avoid repeating the mistakes of the past.
sentences.chinese: 在摸索的過程中，我們應當小心避免重複過去的錯誤。

sentences.english: She fumbled about in her pockets for the ticket.
sentences.chinese: 她在口袋裏摸索着找票。

sentences.english: Show yourself the ropes and you’ll understand them better.
sentences.chinese: 你自己去摸索，這樣你會明白地更快。

sentences.english: Objective To explore a new method rearing diamondback moth, Plutella xylostella (L. ).
sentences.chinese: 目的摸索小菜蛾飼養新方法。

sentences.english: He fumbles in his hoodie pockets and finds his BlackBerry.
sentences.chinese: 他摸索着自己的上衣兜並發現了他的黑莓。

sentences.english: I groped my way to a door, opened it, and instantly began to cough.
sentences.chinese: 我摸索着走到一扇門前，開了門，立刻咳嗽起來。

sentences.english: He moved down the spine toward the tail, probing around each vertebra with the handle of his brush.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着刷子，移向尾部脊椎，細細摸索。

definition: to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: to explore/to probe
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to study meticulously/to delve into
lit. crossing the river by feeling for stones/improvise by trial-and-error/move cautiously
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
to look for/to seek/to find fault
to deduce/to infer/to derive/an implication
experience/to experience
to try/to attempt/CL:次[ci4]
to improve/to make better/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to start from scratch
doorway/gateway
the way to do sth/knack
practiced/proficient/skilled/skillful
